newsitem.title: UK: EMI up on reports of improved market share.
newsitem.headline: EMI up on reports of improved market share.

text.p: Shares in EMI Group Plc, one of the world's top music publishers, advanced on Tuesday, ignoring the general market skid, after a press report suggesting the group is gaining market share, dealers said.
By 1039 GMT, the stock -- one of only two FTSE 100 stocks to post gains -- was up 11-1/2p to 1130p.
The Financial Times said a report from Corporate Intelligence on Retailing showed that supermarkets' have seen their music and video shares rise.
Many supermarket chains have achieved market share growth by cutting prices on CDs.
In its report, the group warned that the market may be disabilised if supermarkets discount too aggressively on recorded music and videos. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 5106
